physical_appearance:The image displays the front cover of a travel guidebook. It is rectangular in shape. The image on the front cover features two ladies posing and looking in the direction where the photograph was captured. They are dressed in sarong wear and the background features flowers and foliage. The lady in blue to the right is holding a vintage bird cage and leaning against a cane armchair
 which the other lady is sitting on.     The image displays the front cover of a travel guidebook. It is rectangular in shape. sgcool_label_text:This “Welcome to Singapore” visitor guide was published in 1978 by the Singapore Tourist Promotion Board (STPB). Catered to tourists
 this free publication provides an overview of Singapore’s cultural heritage and introduces the main attractions of Singapore. \r\n\r\nThe cover of the visitor guide features a tropical scene of ladies dressed in sarong wear and contains a foreword by the Chairman of the Tourist Promotion Board.\r\nSTPB was created in 1964 as a statutory board by the government to develop and promote Singapore as a tourist destination. \r\n\r\nSTPB’s efforts in marketing Singapore as a holiday destination paid off
 with tourist arrivals increasing from 100
000 in 1964 to over 2 million by 1978.  This “Welcome to Singapore” visitor guide was published in 1978 by the Singapore Tourist Promotion Board (STPB). Catered to tourists

metadata.sgcool_label_text:
This “Welcome to Singapore” visitor guide was published in 1978 by the Singapore Tourist Promotion Board (STPB). Catered to tourists, this free publication provides an overview of Singapore’s cultural heritage and introduces the main attractions of Singapore. 

The cover of the visitor guide features a tropical scene of ladies dressed in sarong wear and contains a foreword by the Chairman of the Tourist Promotion Board.
STPB was created in 1964 as a statutory board by the government to develop and promote Singapore as a tourist destination. 

STPB’s efforts in marketing Singapore as a holiday destination paid off, with tourist arrivals increasing from 100,000 in 1964 to over 2 million by 1978.  This “Welcome to Singapore” visitor guide was published in 1978 by the Singapore Tourist Promotion Board (STPB). Catered to tourists, this free publication provides an overview of Singapore’s cultural heritage and introduces the main attractions of Singapore. 

The cover of the visitor guide features a tropical scene of ladies dressed in sarong wear and contains a foreword by the Chairman of the Tourist Promotion Board.
STPB was created in 1964 as a statutory board by the government to develop and promote Singapore as a tourist destination. 

STPB’s efforts in marketing Singapore as a holiday destination paid off, with tourist arrivals increasing from 100,000 in 1964 to over 2 million by 1978.
